artist: Printmaker/Publisher Balthasar Moncornet After prints by Oliviero Gatti After Guercino (Giovanni Francesco Barbieri) After prints by Odoardo Fialetti After prints by Jacques Callot
creditline: Gift of Roy and Jean Perkinson
description: artist's sample booklet with pasted-in plates with images of faces and facial features, figures, feet, hands; first image is seated woman with a palette and brushes, preparing to paint in a cartouche containing the title of the book, held up by a putto; no cover; incomplete
text: This pocket-sized booklet was intended to be carried around as a guide to the depiction of human figures. Its 50 plates feature reproductions from Guido Reni and Jacques Callot—two important artists of the 17th century—as well as practical diagrams of bodies and their parts, plus schematic representations such this one, with the head of a child laid out from a series of circles. Geometric construction of the body go back to Dürer's treatises, published more than a century earlier.
title: Livre de Portraiture
